author: robocopsgonemad
content: blockscout seems stuck indexing, in lieu of that i'm treating Nethermind as cannonical. Can someone check my math, because it looks to me like dataGasUsed is wrong on block 0xd10a0acfcb5c7606234576799071fe157687eea08f29b63e47a542ac82b04daf which was included at height 2369. That block claims dataGasUsed was 0x180000, but i'm getting 0xC0000.  3 txs, 2 versionedHashes each, 131072 gas per data block.  One of us is off by a bit, besu is treating DATA_GAS_PER_BLOB == 1 << 17 == 2^17 == 131072. Is it possible DATA_GAS_PER_BLOB in the spec could be interpreted as 2^17 by besu and 2<<17 by nethermind?

author: parithosh
content: You can look at (current time - genesis time)/12, that'll get you close and then you can find the exact block by trial and error (missed slots cause the chaos)

author: __flcl
content: Should I use minimal genesis time or minimal genesis time + 60 seconds? (MIN_GENESIS_TIME)

author: parithosh
content: You'd need to use `minimal genesis time + 60` as that's when the first slot is proposed
